channel.title: USPTO All Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO All events.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent from Europe, you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from May 10-13, 2022.

item.title: Conducting an effective patent examiner interview
item.description: Are you a patent practitioner looking for tips on conducting a successful examiner interview? Join us on Wednesday, May 11 at noon ET for an online session to learn more about this process. This event is free and open to the public, but space is limited, so register today

item.title: USPTO Trade Secrets Symposium 2022: Trending cross-border issues
Learn about current patent application pilot programs and initiatives
item.description: Interested in learning about current patent application pilot programs and initiatives? Join us for a presentation on May 11, led by Christopher Babic, a Supervisory Patent Examiner, who will provide information on the following topics:

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part V: Understanding the role of claims in a patent application
item.description: Are you an inventor preparing to file a patent application? Join us for Part V of our Path to a Patent series. United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will discuss the parts of the claim, show examples of claim illustrations from issued U.S. patents, and help participants develop a better appreciation of how a patent examiner views a claim. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent from Europe, you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from May 10-13, 2022.

item.title: USPTO Trade Secrets Symposium 2022: Trending cross-border issues
What you need to sell your arts and crafts online: Building your identity, for Native American visual artists and craftspeople
Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: PTAB LEAP: AIA mock oral argument practicum
item.description: Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board's (PTAB) Legal Experience and Advancement Program (LEAP) for an America Invents Act (AIA) mock oral argument practicum. The event will take place Friday, May 13, from 1-4 p.m. ET.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent from Europe, you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from May 10-13, 2022.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 7: Keeping your registration alive
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this seventh module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on what happens after registration, including mandatory filings to keep your registration alive. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander Innovation and Entrepreneurship 2022, part one: Find pathways to breakthroughs
item.description: You have ideas, drive, and a vision of success, but what steps will you take to make that vision a reality? Learn to map your way forward from successful innovators who will share hard-earned tips from their own journeys. Register for part one of this free, online event series.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander Innovation and Entrepreneurship 2022, part two: Innovating for real-world solutions
item.description: Do you see a problem that you know you can fix? Do you want to improve the world with your creativity and drive? Learn from successful innovators how they approach, understand, and solve challenges, and how intellectual property protection has been key to their success. Register for part two of this free, online event series.

item.title: Diversifying your market or supply chain: Enforcement
Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VI: Learn how to protect your IP abroad
item.description: Did you know that patents offer territorial rights, meaning that there is no such thing as an international or global patent? Learn how to help protect your intellectual property (IP) in foreign jurisdictions. United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) International Patent Legal Administration experts will discuss considerations and options for filing foreign patent applications. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: PTAB LEAP: AIA oral argument encore
item.description: Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board's (PTAB) Legal Experience and Advancement Program (LEAP) for an America Invents Act (AIA) oral argument encore on Friday, May 20, from noon to 1 p.m. ET.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 8: Question-and-answer panel
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this final module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll provide a unique opportunity for you to 'meet the trademark experts.' Come prepared with all of your trademark questions to share with our Law Office Managing Attorneys and other trademark experts. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Learn how examiners approach 35 U.S.C. § 103: Writing rejections
item.description: Want to learn more about examination practices and procedural guidance given to examiners for writing 35 U.S.C. § 103 rejections?

item.title: Learn how examiners approach 35 U.S.C. § 103 writing rejections
item.description: Would you like to learn more about examination practices and procedural guidance for 35 U.S.C. § 103 writing rejections? Register today for part two of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) virtual Instructor-Led Training (vILT) series on May 25. The course has limited capacity, and selection for attendance is based on a first-come, first-served basis.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Learn how examiners approach 35 U.S.C. § 103 writing rejections
item.description: Would you like to learn more about examination practices and procedural guidance for 35 U.S.C. § 103 writing rejections? Register today for part two of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) virtual Instructor-Led Training (vILT) series on May 26. The course has limited capacity, and selection for attendance is based on a first-come, first-served basis.

item.title: Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
K-12 IP education office hours
Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VII: How to file a patent application using Patent Center
item.description: Looking for more information on using Patent Center? United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will teach participants how to use this tool to file and manage patent documents online. This presentation will feature filing application documents in DOCX format, including using Patent Center training mode to practice filing. You will learn about some helpful resources, such as the Inventors Assistance Center (IAC) and the Patent Electronics Business Center (EBC). Register early for this virtual event.

item.title: PPAC fireside chat with Director Kathi Vidal
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) at the next public PPAC meeting to hear newly-confirmed Director Kathi Vidal answer USPTO stakeholder questions. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO on patent-related policies, goals, performance, budget, and user fees.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part one: From ideas to innovations
item.description: Do you have an idea you want to bring to life? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to get inspired by successful innovators turning concepts into creations. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part one: From ideas to innovations.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VIII: Common mistakes and post-filing support
item.description: Are you an inventor? Join us for this session full of important tips on filing a patent application and what to do after you file for a patent. Learn about common mistakes to avoid and gain a better understanding of post-filing procedures and support. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship
item.description: Are you passionate about taking your special idea to the market? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to learn how to commercialize your innovation. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship.

item.title: Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
K-12 IP education office hours
Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: K-12 IP education office hours
Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.
